posts.title: Basic grammar of Markdown/Markdown的基本语法
posts.text: 1. Header: The symbol “#” indicates the level of a header, which is shown as follows: first-level header “# first-level header”: first-level header second-level header “## second-level header”: second-level header fifth-level Header “## fifth-level header”: fifth-level header And so on. 2. Typeface: Bold: **The text to be bold** Result: The text to be bold Italic: *The test to be italic* Result: The text to be italic Bold and Italic: ***The test to be bold and italic*** Result: The test to be bold and italic Strikethough: ~~The test to be trikethough~~ Result: The test to be trikethough 3. Quotation: The symbol “>” indicates the level of a quotation just as what “#” does. Grammar: > the quotation >This is the first-level quotation And so on. 4. Split Line: Symbol: more than 3 “-“ or “*“, the results are shown as follows: 5.Figure: Grammar: ![the caption(shown below the fiure)](the address of the figure (can be online or offline)”the title of the fiure(shown when the mouse is over the figure)”) However, the offline way is not recommanded. 6. Hyperlink: Grammar: [Hyperlink’s name](Address “title”) Emoji’s website 7. List: Unordered: symbol ‘-’ or ‘+’ or ‘*‘, the result is just like this line. Ordered: 1. or 2. or 3. and so on, the result is just like this line. nesting: three ‘ ‘(blank) between the indexes. 8. Table:Grammar:(No blank line!) header 1|header 2|deader 3 —|:–:|—: content 11|content 21|content 31 content 12|content 22|content 32 The result is as follows: header 1 header 2 deader 3 content 11 content 21 content 31 content 12 content 22 content 32 9. Code:Grammar: ‘One line code’ create database hero; ‘’’ A passage of code’’’ 1234function fun(){ echo "Hello world!";}fun();

posts.title: Basic usage of EndNote/EndNote的基本使用
Hello World
posts.text: Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub. Quick StartCreate a new post1$ hexo new "My New Post" More info: Writing Run server1$ hexo server More info: Server Generate static files1$ hexo generate More info: Generating Deploy to remote sites1$ hexo deploy More info: Deployment
